content:
SqlChars Class

Definition

SqlChars is a mutable reference type that wraps a Char array or a SqlString instance.

In this Article

[System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemaProvider("GetXsdType")]
public sealed class SqlChars : System.Data.SqlTypes.INullable, System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable, System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable
Inheritance
System.Object
SqlChars

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

SqlChars can be obtained for varchar, nvarchar, char, nchar, text, and ntext values, or can be created over an unmanaged buffer.

Constructors

SqlChars()

Initializes a new instance of the SqlChars class.

public SqlChars ();

Remarks

The maximum length allowed for SqlChars is bound by the common language runtime maximum size of an Int32 (2,147,483,647).

SqlChars(Char[])

Initializes a new instance of the SqlChars class based on the specified character array.

public SqlChars (char[] buffer);
buffer
Char[]

A Char array.

Remarks

The maximum length allowed for SqlChars is bound by the common language runtime maximum size of an Int32 (2,147,483,647).

If a null reference is passed in, the instance is set to null.

SqlChars(SqlString)

Initializes a new instance of the SqlChars class based on the specified SqlString value.

public SqlChars (System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString value);
value
SqlString

A SqlString.

Remarks

The maximum length allowed for SqlChars is bound by the common language runtime maximum size of an Int32 (2,147,483,647).

If a null reference is passed in, the instance is set to null.

Properties

Buffer

Returns a reference to the internal buffer.

public char[] Buffer { get; }
Value
Char[]

Returns a reference to the internal buffer. For SqlChars instances created on top of unmanaged pointers, it returns a managed copy of the internal buffer.

Remarks

Returns a null reference for null value SqlChars.

Throws an InvalidOperationException for stream-wrapped instances of SqlChars.

IsNull

Gets a Boolean value that indicates whether this SqlChars is null.

public bool IsNull { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the SqlChars is null. Otherwise, false.

Remarks

The default value is false. For more information, see Handling Null Values.

Item(Int64)

Gets or sets the SqlChars instance at the specified index.

public char this[long offset] { get; set; }
offset
Int64

An Int64 value.

Value
Char

A Char value.

Length

Gets the length of the value that is contained in the SqlChars instance.

public long Length { get; }
Value
Int64

A Int64 value that indicates the length in characters of the value that is contained in the SqlChars instance.

Returns -1 if no buffer is available to the instance, or if the value is null.

Returns a stem.IO.Stream.Length* for a stream-wrapped instance.

Remarks

The default value is 0.

MaxLength

Gets the maximum length in two-byte characters of the value the internal buffer can hold.

public long MaxLength { get; }
Value
Int64

An Int64 value representing the maximum length in two-byte characters of the value of the internal buffer.

Returns -1 for a stream-wrapped SqlChars.

Remarks

The default value is 0.

Null

Returns a null instance of this SqlChars.

public static System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars Null { get; }
Value
SqlChars

Returns an instance in such a way that stem.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars.IsNull* returns true. For more information, see Handling Null Values.

Storage

Returns information about the storage state of this SqlChars instance.

public System.Data.SqlTypes.StorageState Storage { get; }
Value
StorageState

A StorageState enumeration.

Value

Returns a managed copy of the value held by this SqlChars.

public char[] Value { get; }
Value
Char[]

The value of this SqlChars as an array of characters.

Remarks

Returns a null reference for null value SqlChars.

Methods

GetXsdType(XmlSchemaSet)

Returns the XML Schema definition language (XSD) of the specified XmlSchemaSet.

public static System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName GetXsdType (System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSet schemaSet);
schemaSet
XmlSchemaSet

A XmlSchemaSet.

Returns
XmlQualifiedName

A string value that indicates the XSD of the specified XmlSchemaSet.

Read(Int64,Char[],Int32,Int32)

Copies characters from this SqlChars instance to the passed-in buffer and returns the number of copied characters.

public long Read (long offset, char[] buffer, int offsetInBuffer, int count);
offset
Int64

An Int64long value offset into the value that is contained in the SqlChars instance.

buffer
Char[]

The character array buffer to copy into.

offsetInBuffer
Int32

An Int32 integer offset into the buffer to start copying into.

count
Int32

An Int32 integer value representing the number of characters to copy.

Returns
Int64

An Int64long value representing the number of copied bytes.

Remarks

If an attempt is made to read beyond MaxLength, an exception is thrown.

If count specifies more characters to be copied than are available from the offsetInBuffer to the end of the value, only the available characters are copied.

An exception is thrown if the destination buffer is a null reference.

An exception is thrown if the destination buffer cannot receive as many characters as requested.

SetLength(Int64)

Sets the length of this SqlChars instance.

public void SetLength (long value);
value
Int64

The Int64long value representing the length.

Remarks

This method will trigger an internal conversion to a managed buffer for an instance built on top of an unmanaged buffer.

SetNull()

Sets this SqlChars instance to null.

public void SetNull ();

ToSqlString()

Converts this SqlChars instance to its equivalent SqlString representation.

public System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString ToSqlString ();
Returns
SqlString

A SqlString representation of this type.

Write(Int64,Char[],Int32,Int32)

Copies characters from the passed-in buffer to this SqlChars instance.

public void Write (long offset, char[] buffer, int offsetInBuffer, int count);
offset
Int64

A long value offset into the value that is contained in the SqlChars instance.

buffer
Char[]

The character array buffer to copy into.

offsetInBuffer
Int32

An Int32 integer offset into the buffer to start copying into.

count
Int32

An Int32 integer representing the number of characters to copy.

Remarks

If this operation writes to a position beyond Length but within MaxLength, Length is updated to reflect the new ending position.

The value of offsetInBuffer must be less than or equal to Length. An exception is thrown otherwise. Only a value of 0 can be specified when writing to a null value instance.

If an attempt is made to write beyond MaxLength, an exception is thrown.

public static System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString op_Explicit (System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars value);

SqlChars

SqlString

Returns

To be added.

Gets serialization information with all the data needed to reinstantiate this SqlChars instance.

The object to be populated with serialization information.

The destination context of the serialization.

This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

r
XmlReader

This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

void IXmlSerializable.WriteXml (System.Xml.XmlWriter writer);
writer
